attributes.additional_details:
We are currently classed as homeless and at no fixed abode. We are struggling to be accepted on private rent because despite me and my husband both working our annual income is not high enough for private rent. 
So many people are in a similar boat to us. The landlords should not be allowed to charge such a high rent and at least they should accept universal credit as a form of top up income so then hard working people would then be able to afford a roof over their heads.
attributes.background: With landlords charging high rent even hard working families or single people aren't being accepted because their income is apparently too low. Also alot of estate agents do not accept universal credit as a top up on the rent so that also goes against hard working people.

rejection.details:
Stop landlords refusing potential tenants because they claim benefits: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/637032

Cap yearly rent increases for private tenants to average increase in pay: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/635142

You may also wish to sign this petition which we have published:
Nationalise private rental properties: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/636732

You can find some information about finding housing here: 

https://england.shelter.org.uk/housing_advice

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/housing/homelessness/applying-for-homeless-help/check-if-you-can-apply-for-homeless-help/
